headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  GARSON, DR. HOWARD S.

docs.snippet: GARSON--Dr. Howard S.,86, died suddenly Tuesday, April 29, 2014. Beloved husband of Bettijane Sills Garson, devoted father of James Garson and step-daughter Frances Garson Trocki, grandfather to David, Peter, James, Susan and Henry, and great-gran...
docs.lead_paragraph: GARSON--Dr. Howard S.,86, died suddenly Tuesday, April 29, 2014. Beloved husband of Bettijane Sills Garson, devoted father of James Garson and step-daughter Frances Garson Trocki, grandfather to David, Peter, James, Susan and Henry, and great-grandchildren Nora and Ellen. After serving in the United States Navy from 1945-1947, Dr. Garson went to NYU on the G-I Bill, attended medical school in Bern and Zurich, Switzerland and opened a private practice in Pediatrics in Bronxville, NY in 1960. He served as Director of Pediatrics and was President of the Medical Staff at Law- rence Hospital. After retiring from medicine Howard enjoyed life and lived it to the fullest playing tennis and golf and attending dance performances whenever he could. His kindness and humanity as a physician and human being will long be remembered. He was a true gentleman and will be deeply missed by all. A funeral service will be held on Friday, May 2, 2014 at 10am at Ballard-Durand Funeral Home, 2 Maple Ave., White Plains. Interment to follow at Kensico Cemetery.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  DEL CASTILLO JARDINES, LUIS

docs.lead_paragraph: DEL CASTILLO JARDINES--Luis, died Monday, April 28, 2014 at his home in New York City. He is survived by spouse Lourdes; children Miguel, Miguelina, Jose (Jessica), Liz (Randy); siblings Luz, Nena, Julieta, Margot, Lina, Horacio, Else; grandchildren Vic, Julio, Patty, Michelle, Julissa, Melissa, Marilu, Raquel, Erik, Mikey, Jagger. Family to receive friends and relatives atFrank E. Campbell Funeral Home, 1076 Madison Ave, New York, NY on Thursday, May 1, 2014, 4pm-8pm. Funeral Mass: Friday, May 2, 10am, Our Lady of Peace Church, 237 E. 62nd St., New York.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  DANWITZ, SISTER WINIFRED

docs.snippet: DANWITZ--Sister Winifred, Ursuline died peacefully at Andrus on Hudson on Tuesday, April 29, 2014 at 93. Her notable achievement was founding in 1961 the Mount St. Ursula Speech Center, for children with speech and hearing disabilities. Sr. Winifr...
docs.lead_paragraph: DANWITZ--Sister Winifred, Ursuline died peacefully at Andrus on Hudson on Tuesday, April 29, 2014 at 93. Her notable achievement was founding in 1961 the Mount St. Ursula Speech Center, for children with speech and hearing disabilities. Sr. Winifred earned a MA from Brooklyn College and her Ph.D. from CUNY. She entered the Ursulines in 1945 and taught at the College of New Rochelle, the Academy of Mt. St. Ursula, Fordham University, Hunter College, and Iona College. She was a director of speech therapy, Archdiocese of NY, and professor of special education at CNR. In 1997 she founded Angela House, a transitional residence and place for homeless women and their children. Winifred served on several boards and received numerous awards for her teaching and service. She was predeceased by her parents, Eric and Winifred (O'Shea) Danwitz, and her sister Lillian; she is survived by several nieces and nephews. Wake will be held at the Ursuline Provincialate, 1338 North Avenue, New Rochelle, NY, on Friday, May 2, 3-5pm and 6-8pm. Mass of Christian Burial will be there at 10am on Saturday, May 3. Interment, Holy Sepulchre Cemetery. Gifts may be sent to the Ursuline Retirement Fund, 1338 North Avenue, New Rochelle, NY 10804. www.lloydmaxcy.com

We extended deepest sympathy to his wife Jan, to his son Ryan and to the entire family. Aubrey L. Glazer, Rabbi Norton D. Shargel, Rabbi Emeritus Israel Singer, Cantor Abby Mendelsohn, Martin Rogowsky, Co-Pres.

docs.snippet: AMERMAN--Patricia. April 30, 2014, New York, NY. Patricia Amerman, beloved friend and colleague. Together with her friends and family, Rubenstein mourns the loss of Pat Amerman, a dedicated and beloved employee of the agency for 17 years. Pat was ...
docs.lead_paragraph: AMERMAN--Patricia. April 30, 2014, New York, NY. Patricia Amerman, beloved friend and colleague. Together with her friends and family, Rubenstein mourns the loss of Pat Amerman, a dedicated and beloved employee of the agency for 17 years. Pat was a warm, joyful, and positive person who always had a smile on her face. A skilled publicist, she won the respect and friendship of clients, colleagues and reporters alike. Whether she was overseeing publicity for clients at the New Year's Eve celebrations in Times Square, garnering wide coverage for Marble Collegiate Church in response to its "yellow ribbon" campaign honoring U.S. troops in Iraq, or helping to publicize the fundraising campaign for the renovation of St. Patrick's Cathedral, Pat was a master public relations strategist the utmost professional who gave her all to making every project a success. Even through her long battle with cancer, Pat insisted on working. She truly loved what she did. Pat had a wonderful network of friends and family that meant the world to her. She was dedicated to her parents and extremely proud of both her Irish and Greek heritages. Pat also was involved with community affairs in her Queens, NY neighborhood. The wake will be on Sunday, May 4, from 3:00 to 8:00pm at O'Shea-Hoey Funeral Home in Astoria. Pat relished life and made the most of her time. We will greatly miss our dear colleague and friend. Howard J. Rubenstein, Founder Steven Rubenstein, President

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  HAUGE, HELEN RESOR

docs.lead_paragraph: HAUGE--Helen Resor. The Board of Directors and staff of Henry Street Settlement mourn the loss of Honorary Board Member Helen R. Hauge, who served as a long standing supporter and tireless advocate of our social service programs. We extend our deepest condolences to her family.

docs.snippet: KEIDAN--Juliet. Harvard Hillel notes with sadness the passing of Juliet Keidan, mother of our dear friend David Keidan. Our hearts are uplifted hearing of her long and fruitful life. We wish David and his family comfort and consolation in Juliet's...
docs.lead_paragraph: KEIDAN--Juliet. Harvard Hillel notes with sadness the passing of Juliet Keidan, mother of our dear friend David Keidan. Our hearts are uplifted hearing of her long and fruitful life. We wish David and his family comfort and consolation in Juliet's memory, amid all mourners of Zion and Jerusalem.
